name: Mantra Trilogy Resort

reviews.text: Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment over Christmas. The hotel is in a excellent location, 2 minutes walk to the Esplanade and centre of Cairns. The apartment was clean, spacious and well equipped. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The only drawback for me was that my bedroom overlooked the Aplin St bat colony, the bats make a lot of noise when returning to their roosts' early each morning.
reviews.title: Good hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the most luxurious resort that we stayed in while on our seven week plus New Zealand - Australia trip. I was very spacious with two bedrooms and two baths with a view of the swiimming pool and bay beyond. Everything was provided. The only negative was that there was only four of everything: four dinner plates, four soup or cereal bowls, four water glasses, four forks, four knives, four teaspoons, etc. and etc. So for two couples plus a two year old we were constantly having to wash dishes or run the dishwasher--an inconvenience to be sure. Otherwise, we had no complaints. The desk staff was especially helpful.
reviews.title: Luxury with a view

reviews.text: Stayed at Trilogy for 7 nights in a pool view hotel room. Location is great, easy walk to everything you need in Cairns. Front desk staff very helpful and friendly. Lobby functional.
reviews.title: Not luxury, but if price is right good bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room itself was large, but bathroom was tiny. (Shower door hits sink when opened, door to bathroom hits toilet...) Balcony was almost big enough to sit on if the chairs are against the windows! Room was clean. However, when hallways are sprayed for bugs, you might expect to find dead bugs on the floor the first night. But the same dead bugs two mornings later???
reviews.title: Great hotel right on the esplanade

reviews.text: It may be hard to tell from the pictures, but if you are facing the pool, there is no privacy at all when the curtains to your room are open. You can see into other rooms and they can see into yours. Sadly, the only curtains are blackout curtains, so if you don't want strangers watching you move around, you have to close out the view entirely. Internet expensive. TV channels minimal.
reviews.title: Excellent time-share swap

description: Mantra Trilogy ideally located above the Cairns Esplanade, with direct access to shops, restaurants and cafes. All apartments offer an open plan design and are air conditioned. Spacious living and dining areas open on to balconies with attractive outlooks, ideal for casual entertaining. Property facilities include: Babysitting facilities available, Barbecue facilities, direct access to dining and shopping precinct, Gymnasium, Outdoor pool, Undercover parking - subject to availability, Tour desk.
